body:
We still need your demo, even you are using undertow.

@ascrutae  Spring MVC should works well, independent on Tomcat.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/17849536/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/17849536)

Coverage remained the same at 24.442% when pulling **1b5920052ef676954a7f92d986ec2e41eb241e2f on update-release-tag** into **6a7e344dea75627c9d6011738c5a3e71e9fc4173 on master**.
What do you mean about `non microservice standalone java applications`? I am not following. Desktop application? or something?
A simple java application that does not have any rest apis exposed.

> A simple java application that does not have any rest apis exposed.

Then what do you want an APM to do for that application? Tracing SQL access maybe?
to trace all the outbound http/https/sql/no-sql calls

> 如果项目里面用了spring devtool或classloader，有办法可以解决吗？

This is the conflict if you are using Spring devtool. We have a very special mechanism for class loader work with the plugins. 

If you can provide more detail about how your classloader works? We can discuss. If you are using devtool, I don't think we need to fix this, devtool doesn't need in the product or test env, which is APM works.

> to trace all the outbound http/https/sql/no-sql calls

If the application doesn't exit after the calls, because we are using async sending mechanism, it definitely can trace those outgoing RPC calls.
yes traces are available, but we are not able to see the topology of the application

> yes traces are available, but we are not able to see the topology of the application

You should. From this application to other remotes nodes in normal cases.
any sample spring-boot standalone java app to test?

> any sample spring-boot standalone java app to test?

We haven't. Sorry. But in theory, it should be. Because in SkyWalking core, topology is from the every RPC, no matter it is incoming or outgoing.
ok, I have changed it.
OK,Here is my test demo:https://github.com/BlackEragon/api-demo.git
For startTimeMillis, could do send a pull request to fix?
yes, is my pleasure
Please don't close before pr mergrd. This is for track.
I have send a pull request
Ci fails, please recheck your codes.

@wu-sheng It  look like doesn't my mistake,please help
[error info](https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-skywalking/builds/401144387?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification)

I am not sure, application.yml and webapp.yml are different. You need two ports to listen.

FYI @hanahmily please recheck our ongoing release. Maybe explain more?
Can't merge because of ci. Really need to resolve it first.
@peng-yongsheng please notice ci in master. You merge this by ignoring ci status.
@hanahmily It has been a whole, could you review this?

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/17898314/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/17898314)

Coverage remained the same at 24.588% when pulling **a11d62b37a287e5b01a54aa7ca569ea721170e9e on xinzhuxiansheng:master** into **8eb2bef192aa2a9f875fc8e36b8196d3b002223c on apache:master**.
I have check this config on MacOS with "webappService.sh" script, seems they are all right. Could @zone1511 give more details about OS version, JDK version and which command to run?

hi @hanahmily 
I run in `windows` environment with `jdk 1.8.0`
and if I run the `bin/webappService.bat`, the web console will listen on port 8080.
If I change the port setting in `webapp.yml` , the web console still listen on port 8080. I need to change the `application.yml` embed in the `skywalking-webapp.jar` in `webap`p directory in order to change the webconsole listen port
5.3.0 I think. Actually, 5.3 should work. We are using 5.5 client driver.
thx，晟哥
Merging, @xinzhuxiansheng thank for your hard works. Being so late to do these contributions. Very appreciate.
Some test cases unfinished, I will supplement them later.
This issue has been fix in PR: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/1290
We should not add the ASF License header to the iconfont.svg if the file is just copied from dant.

I found a mistake. If spring cloud bus is used, agent will produce an exception.
```
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
    <artifactId>spring-cloud-bus</artifactId>
</dependency>
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.springframework.cloud</groupId>
    <artifactId>spring-cloud-starter-stream-rabbit</artifactId>
</dependency>
```

Spring Cloud Dalston.SR5
The startup sequence looks like strange, do you add our agent lib to your classpath?  My guess the lib was loaded again and again with different class loaderd
@peng-yongsheng Issue shouldn't be set in the closed milestone.

@wu-sheng  3ks， 

I found  skywalking-agent.jar not in classpath，then I add `-Djava.ext.dirs=xxx/skywalking-agent.jar`, resolve it!
Strange way to solve. But anyway, it is good.
@peng-yongsheng Merging this. Since we have 6.0, I will start to do cherry-pick for agent bug fix.
What is wrong

Don't try to update SkyWalking without deleting the existed es tables.

Simple way, delete es data folder. All data will lose, agent need reboot.

I think we haven't support Spring Cloud Bus yet, from our supported list. But still, @ascrutae can you consider to add this in?
From this error log, it is more like an incompatible issue, than Spring Cloud Bus issue.

Good PR. First please read plugin test document: https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/skywalking-agent-testcases/blob/master/docs/how-to-write-a-plugin-testcase-cn.md and send a pr to https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/skywalking-agent-testcases . Then please provide test result in that PR.

Thanks.
@ascrutae takes charge of that part.
Cancel this.
any update?

@wu-sheng after renamed the package to `org.apache.skywalking.apm.webapp.proxy` 
does the file  `apm-webapp/src/main/resources/application.yml` need to update the entry from `org.apache.skywalking.apm.webapp.tools.CollectorServerList` to `org.apache.skywalking.apm.webapp.proxy.CollectorServerList`?
I am not sure. If should, you could send a pr directly.

You need to find out:
1. Does the agent  collect trace? Does agent register work?
1. Does the collector receive the data?

Your question is impossible to answer. And not topology data, just trace.

First, you can find we are running the CI(travis-ci) all the time. You can find the build log from here: https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-skywalking

I don't think the codes have any issue to trigger this problem. Please check your network, this is a big project, need download a lot of things.
The same issue happens to me. And UI has no application topology data.
@zone1511 this https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/1392 pr has renamed the config.
I think you can refer to https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/FAQ/Protoc-Plugin-Fails-When-Build.md
Please follow ES documents.

Elasticsearch client is the answer. I am using docker deployment es, you can refer to https://github.com/docker-library/elasticsearch/issues/162。If you are only one node, you must turn off the sniff feature.
.put("client.transport.sniff", false)
We can't accept this kind of issue. You need to find what happens in the agent. The visualization can't tell us anything.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26588578/42749193-7e543542-8915-11e8-967d-577d221e03bd.png)


Is nothing wrong in skywalking-api.log
Because es has data, I think this issue is not agent's problem.

I mean, your descriptions are helpless for us. We can't provide any info for you. You can easily debug the data in collector, and find out why it doesn't show up in elasticsearch. After you have something, we can discuss more.
存在同样问题

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/17999800/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/17999800)

Coverage decreased (-0.004%) to 24.591% when pulling **70d930b756434aa93e6f6840c199bcb71304c9f7 on wu-sheng-patch-1** into **44fc3e0742549d1916094b9292e59c05618d1084 on master**.

Peer doesn't include the endpoint path. Such as:
- peer:  127.0.0.1:8080
- URL: http://127.0.0.1:8080/abc/def

I mean the port between peer and url is different.And if you don't set port in URI , the value is -1.

- peer:`(requestURL.getPort() > 0 ? requestURL.getPort():"https".equalsIgnoreCase(requestURL.getScheme()) ? 443 : 80)`

- URL:`requestURL.getHost()`

I see. You can submit a pr to make URL right. In theory, these two needn't be the same as always. But the URL definitely needs the port.
You didn't just reboot, you deleted data in storage. The system can't run in that way. You need to reboot agents too.
@peng-yongsheng Can't find out what is happening.
Because the compiled RemoteCommonServiceGrpc.java files of collector-remote-grpc-provider project will compile errors.
Thanks,I found after I reboot all the agents ,it works

> Because the compiled RemoteCommonServiceGrpc.java files of collector-remote-grpc-provider project will compile errors.

So strange, why, the dependency should exist. Otherwise, `mvn compile`should fail.

incubator-skywalking-ui 代码没下载导致的。

执行：git submodule update

This is the protection mechanism of Skywalking and this error show us that there are more than the value of the `agent.span_limit_per_segment` configuration item(default: 300) in one trace. Is there some background task in your application, or someone else?
Duplicate issue: #1454, close this issue
Sorry for the mistake. I fill the wrong issue id. ignore the the ref.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/18033606/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/18033606)

Coverage increased (+0.007%) to 24.598% when pulling **bf91c89e770df3c96e765b85a93f4911ee02b861 on ascrutae:fix/spring-aop-issue-1** into **7744911c32e7179ffdf6b9cbaed19ae019338fc6 on apache:master**.

This issue is that there isn't any `TraceContext` created before the spring interceptors invoked. because of the spring plugin store the `request` and the `response` object in `RuntimeContext` in `TraceContext`.

@wu-sheng Maybe we can't store  `request` and `response` in `RuntimeContext`. What do you think about it?
mvn can be compiled successfully, but grpc source code will display errors, adding guava dependency is normal.
@ascrutae  no
Is there any configuration changes should be applied ?
We do some performance improvement in beta2. But we need your data to find out what is going on.
We didn't receive any report about this yet.
Fixed
What kind of data do you need ? And how ?
You can package your elastic search node folder, and upload here.
I think you overuse `RuntimeContext`. It is designed for across plugins communication only. Consider to use `TraceContext`.

[data.tar.gz](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/files/2204673/data.tar.gz)
###ES version: 5.6.8
@peng-yongsheng Please check this.
